title: Emile Sheng
text:
Emile Sheng (; born 5 January 1968) is a <a href="Taiwan">Taiwanese</a> politician. He was the Minister of the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Culture%20%28Taiwan%29">Council for Cultural Affairs</a> from 2009 to 2011.
Education.
Sheng obtained his bachelor's degree in diplomacy from <a href="National%20Chengchi%20University">National Chengchi University</a> and doctoral degree in political science from <a href="Northwestern%20University">Northwestern University</a> in the <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Early career.
Sheng was the chief executive officer of the <a href="2009%20Summer%20Deaflympics">2009 Summer Deaflympics</a> organizing committee in <a href="Taipei">Taipei</a> in 2009.
Council of Cultural Affairs.
On 17 November 2011, Sheng tendered his resignation after he was criticized for organizing an extravagant musical to celebrate the 100th anniversary of the <a href="National%20Day%20of%20the%20Republic%20of%20China">National Day of the Republic of China</a> which cost NT$215 million.
